title: lua-luaposix needs unzip, adding dependency to lua doesn't work, what to do?
body:
I'm having my first Spack on Ubuntu adventure, using a very minimally configured Ubuntu instance on AWS.

lua-luaposix wouldn't install:

```
1 error found in build log:
  >> 5    Error: Directory luaposix-release-v33.4.0 not found inside archive release-v33.4.0.zip
     6    Using luaposix-33.4.0-1.rockspec... switching to 'build' mode
```

I can fix it by using `apt-get` to install the *unzip* package.

I thought that I could fix it for all luarocks based packages by adding 

```diff
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/lua/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/lua/package.py
index eec46f9..cdc63f8 100644
--- a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/lua/package.py
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/lua/package.py
@@ -49,6 +49,7 @@ class Lua(Package):

     depends_on('ncurses')
     depends_on('readline')
+    depends_on('unzip', type='build')

     resource(
         name="luarocks",
```

but that didn't work.  The dependency is there:

```
hartzell@ubuntu-spack-test:~/spack$ spack spec lua-luaposix
Input spec
--------------------------------
lua-luaposix

Concretized
--------------------------------
lua-luaposix@33.4.0%gcc@5.5.0 arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64
    ^lua@5.3.4%gcc@5.5.0 arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64
        ^ncurses@6.1%gcc@5.5.0~symlinks~termlib arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64
            ^pkgconf@1.4.2%gcc@5.5.0 arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64
        ^readline@7.0%gcc@5.5.0 arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64
        ^unzip@6.0%gcc@5.5.0 arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64
```

but it seems like that PATH isn't being set up for the top level.

Adding the depend to *lua-luaposix* does work:

```diff
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/lua-luaposix/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/lua-luaposix/package.py
index 4db3f84..f29ea54 100644
--- a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/lua-luaposix/package.py
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/lua-luaposix/package.py
@@ -34,6 +34,7 @@ class LuaLuaposix(Package):
     version('33.4.0', 'b36ff049095f28752caeb0b46144516c')

     extends("lua")
+    depends_on('unzip', type='build')

     def install(self, spec, prefix):
         rockspec = glob.glob('luaposix-*.rockspec')
```

Is the right fix here to use the system unzip or to update *lua-luaposix* or?

g.
